cvar.name: ESCAPE
cvar.summary: A function that will be called to escape shell special characters in command lines. The function should take one argument: the command line string to escape; and should return the escaped command line.

cvar.name: LIBPREFIX
cvar.summary: The prefix used for (static) library file names. A default value is set for each platform (posix, win32, os2, etc.), but the value is overridden by individual tools (ar, mslib, sgiar, sunar, tlib, etc.) to reflect the names of the libraries they create.

cvar.name: LIBPREFIXES
cvar.summary: A list of all legal prefixes for library file names. When searching for library dependencies, SCons will look for files with these prefixes, the base library name, and suffixes in the &cv-LIBSUFFIXES; list.

cvar.name: LIBSUFFIX
cvar.summary: The suffix used for (static) library file names. A default value is set for each platform (posix, win32, os2, etc.), but the value is overridden by individual tools (ar, mslib, sgiar, sunar, tlib, etc.) to reflect the names of the libraries they create.

cvar.name: LIBSUFFIXES
cvar.summary: A list of all legal suffixes for library file names. When searching for library dependencies, SCons will look for files with prefixes, in the &cv-LIBPREFIXES; list, the base library name, and these suffixes.

cvar.name: OBJPREFIX
cvar.summary: The prefix used for (static) object file names.

cvar.name: OBJSUFFIX
cvar.summary: The suffix used for (static) object file names.

cvar.name: PLATFORM
HOST_OS
cvar.summary: The name of the host operating system used to create the Environment. If a platform is specified when creating the Environment, then that Platform's logic will handle setting this value. This value is immutable, and should not be changed by the user after the Environment is initialized. Currently only set for Win32.

cvar.name: HOST_ARCH
cvar.summary: The name of the host hardware architecture used to create the Environment. If a platform is specified when creating the Environment, then that Platform's logic will handle setting this value. This value is immutable, and should not be changed by the user after the Environment is initialized. Currently only set for Win32.

cvar.name: TARGET_OS
cvar.summary: The name of the target operating system for the compiled objects created by this Environment. This defaults to the value of HOST_OS, and the user can override it. Currently only set for Win32.

cvar.name: TARGET_ARCH
cvar.summary: The name of the target hardware architecture for the compiled objects created by this Environment. This defaults to the value of HOST_ARCH, and the user can override it. Currently only set for Win32.

cvar.name: PROGPREFIX
cvar.summary: The prefix used for executable file names.

cvar.name: PROGSUFFIX
cvar.summary: The suffix used for executable file names.

cvar.name: SHELL
SHLIBPREFIX
cvar.summary: The prefix used for shared library file names.

cvar.name: SHLIBSUFFIX
cvar.summary: The suffix used for shared library file names.

cvar.name: SHOBJPREFIX
cvar.summary: The prefix used for shared object file names.

cvar.name: SHOBJSUFFIX
cvar.summary: The suffix used for shared object file names.

cvar.name: TEMPFILEPREFIX
cvar.summary: The prefix for a temporary file used to execute lines longer than $MAXLINELENGTH. The default is '@'. This may be set for toolchains that use other values, such as '-@' for the diab compiler or '-via' for ARM toolchain.
